The 10 finger technique is a really well-known technique for using your computer keyboard successfully. You can type "blindly" on the keyboard with a few methods as well as the right finger settings. If you have less, you can dramatically reduce your error rate as well as speed up your typing. You can also increase your typing speed. Typing speed with monkey type tool. https://monkey-type.org

time: Wed Aug 24 2022 20:20:14 GMT+0200 (Central European Summer Time)
body:
Wow, I was surprised at the price markup for books! Where I live, laws prohibit book stores from adding own markup to books, which means they are the same price on Amazon as on local bookstore.
  This helps banish the power of monopolies like Amazon, who can afford to push prices down¬π, and is supposed to help local bookstores, though it sadly isn‚Äôt enough: Bookstores are dying.

¬π They do that for foreign books where the laws don‚Äôt apply!

Actually, while I agree with the opinion that not everything needs cheese and orange sauce, and that there is no place anywhere for chocolate maggi, I will say that most of our most popular foods are not ingerently indian. For example, the only thing Indian about pav bhaaji is the spices used. Baking was introduced by the portuguese, tomatoes, cauliflower and potatoes were brought in from Mexico and Europe. All the other vegetables in it are a contribution of the western world.

During the civil war, textile trade was halted between the british and the US and this gave the textile industry in India, specifically in Mumbai a huge boost. Pav bhaaji was made as a quick meal made of stale bread and a mash of fast expiring vegetables and indian spices to feed the thousands of textile workers. So in essence just like the humble and much loved pav bhaaji, a story of jugaad and western influence, we may see another creation that could be a staple of indian cuisine in the future
